page.name: Misconceptions About Low Literacy Levels
page.content:
There are misconceptions and stereotypes about people with low literacy skills. It is important for educators to address these misconceptions (Mesler et al., 2021). One way to do this is to share data with learners, other educators, and community members. 

For example, the largest percentage of the population with low literacy skills are White U.S.-born adults, who represent one third of the total people with low literacy skills. 

Hispanic adults born outside the United States make up about a quarter of such low-skilled adults in the United States (see Figure 3 in Additional Resource below).

Additional Resource: National Center for Education Statistics, Adult Literacy in the United States
